definitions.definition: A person who is absent from his or her employment , school , post , duty , etc.
examples: At roll-call there were three absentees .

subdefinitions.definition: Designating a person absent in a particular capacity, sometimes implying that they are difficult to contact, unresponsive, avoiding their responsibilities, etc.
examples: absentee father; absentee landlord; absentee freeholder
subdefinitions.dating_raw: First attested in the mid 19 century.

definitions.definition: Something that is not present where it might be expected.
examples: The manufacturer's promised new model was a notable absentee at the car show.

definitions.definition: Designating something whose owner, person responsible, etc. is absent.
A landholder who lives in another district or country than the one in which his estate is situated.
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the early 17 century.

definitions.definition: A voter who is not present at the time of voting; absentee voter .
definitions.dating_raw: First attested in the early 20 century.

main_definition: A person who is absent from his or her employment , school , post , duty , etc. [First attested around 1350 to 1470.]
secondary_definitions: Something that is not present where it might be expected.
( attributive ) Designating something whose owner, person responsible, etc. is absent.
( chiefly British , historical ) A landholder who lives in another district or country than the one in which his estate is situated. [First attested in the early 17 century.]
A voter who is not present at the time of voting; absentee voter . [First attested in the early 20 century.]
